result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew J Milne was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

DNA Sample.
*Corrected as to Distribution Information*

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew J Milne

records.addlTxt: Letter to Clerk of Court from DA

records.descr: Amended Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt: from DOC with response by Judge Rhode

Defendant Matthew J Milne in court with attorney Cana G Kohn.  Defendant Matthew J Milne in custody.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 2:56 p.m. Sentencing after revocation on ct 1. Parties have reviewed revocation packet and have one change - agree there is a total of 230 days credit. State gives sentencing arguments and recommendation for 5 yrs prison, 3 yrs ic, 2 yrs es w/230 days credit, concurrent to any other sentence currently serving. Sentencing arguments by Atty Kohn, asks for 1 yr ic and 1 yr es. Statement by Defendant. Remarks by the Court. Will give Def choice of two sentences: 1 yr ic, 3 yrs es or 3 yrs ic, 1 yr es. Def understands the choices and asks for 1 yr ic, 3 yrs es, gives reasons. Court orders 4 yrs prison, 1 yr ic, 3 yrs es, credit for 230 days served. Concurrent to any sentences already received. Outstanding financial obligations to be paid from prison wages and through ext supv. Def advised of firearms and voting restrictions. Def eligible for SAP. Not eligible for CIP. Postconviction rights.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on October 17, 2018 at 02:30 pm.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on November 16, 2018 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant
Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Matthew J Milne in court with attorney Peter Joseph Prusinski.  Defendant Matthew J Milne in custody.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 10:16 a.m. Agreement stated - Def will plead to ct 1, dismiss and read in ct 2. Withheld sentence, 2 yrs probation. Ask Court for 100 days credit if revoked. Court costs, DNA sample and surcharge. Atty Prusinski and Def agree. Plea quest. reviewed. Plea to ct 1 - no contest. Ct 2 dismissed and read in on motion of State. Constitutional rights, elements, possible penalties. Atty Prusinski satisfied. Court finds Def understands and plea freely & voluntarily made. Factual basis. Court accepts plea and finds guilty of ct 1 possession of methamphetamine as repeater. Sentencing remarks by Counsel. Statement by Defendant. Sentencing remarks by the Court. Court finds agreement appropriate. Sentence withheld, 2 yrs probation, 100 days credit if revoked, court costs, DNA sample and surcharge. Def advised of firearms and voting restrictions.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Postconviction rights.

Defendant Matthew J Milne in court with attorney Peter Joseph Prusinski.  Defendant Matthew J Milne in custody.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Called at 11:30 am.  Parties are ready to proceed with preliminary.  Kyle Rustick, Antigo Police Office duly sworn on oath, testifies.  Ex # 1 - Officers Report.  No further witnesses.  Atty Prusinski moves to dismiss.  Jurisdiction addressed.  Stipulate to def being identied as Mr. Milne.  Stipulate that def was on felony bond.  Statement by Atty Prusinski.  Statement by Atty Bayne-Allison.  Court finds probable cause.  Bound over.  Information filed.  Waive reading.  Not guilty pleas entered.  Reserve jurisdictional objections.  Court will receive not guilty pleas.  Status conference scheduled for May 16, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
to Extend Time to File Pre-Trial Motions

Defendant Matthew J Milne in court via video, with attorney Peter Joseph Prusinski.  Defendant Matthew J Milne in custody.  Jill Louise Laufenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waive reading of complaint.  Bond has been set at $1000. cash, def has refused to signed.  Def is on probation hold.  State will agree to reduce cash bond.  Court will reduce bond to $500.00 cash  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 7, 2016 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Matthew J Milne in court, via video, in custody.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Def has a hold.  Def to contact the public defender's office for counsel to be appointed.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 21, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
